newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya tea prices firm at weekly auction.
newsitem.headline: Kenya tea prices firm at weekly auction.

text.p: Kenyan tea prices were firm on Monday, boosted by very strong demand at the weekly tea auction in Mombasa, auction officials said.

All brighter liquoring main grades advanced by up to $10. Medium and lower BP1s were 5-10 U.S. cents dearer while coloury medium PF1s were 5-10 cents dearer. Lighter liquoring descriptions were firm by 2-5 cents.
Most grades in the secondary category sold at dearer rates.
Pakistan, Egypt and Sudan lent good support while Britain and Somalia showed more interest on fibrous types.
